data.text: @talentedfergal @MisterRan That's been clear pretty much all along - certainly to the manufacturers! - and that efficacy is limited and then devolves negative very quickly.
@CotswoldsGeezer @MisterRan That would be true, if we were still in 2021 but it's very clear now that this is not really an inoculation, it's a therapeutic with limited efficacy.

@talentedfergal @MisterRan If there was a polio epidemic and 9/10 deaths were in the vaccinated it would cut through any dissembling.

Maybe the greatest trick played during this pandemic of trickery is to get people to believe that it's totally normal to get jabbed against Covid and then die from it.
@talentedfergal @MisterRan Yep, same thought crossed my mind.
@jena50935479 @MisterRan Not sure about that. If you're not scared enough to take the vax, I'm not sure you're doing anything else to reduce risk. I know I'm not.

@talentedfergal @MisterRan Yes valid point I think. I’ve also heard it said that the vaxxed are more likely to test +ve as they believe they are safe and therefore engage in more risky behaviours. This one I’m not sure about. But if true, surely a -ve to rolling vax out?!
